Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/8.0-preview7] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#9532)

Issues.Title: An exception popped up when click "Print with error" button
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

 .NET 8.0.100-rc.1.23369.12

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

In a video below:
- "Print successfully" button sets PrintPreviewControl.Document property to a document of 1 page;
- "Print with error" button sets PrintPreviewControl.Document property to a document that fails to generate a preview;
- "Reset" button sets PrintPreviewControl.Document property to null.

Note that an exception pops up a few seconds after clicking "Print with error" button

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/108860782/28cd18ab-dac4-40e0-a5b9-a004dea2bb13

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/108860782/30de529b-a432-42d9-8b2e-c157bf311e9f)
**Call Stack:**
System.Exception
  HResult=0x80131500
  Message=Something went wrong.
  Source=SampleApp
  StackTrace:
   at SampleApp.Form1.ErroneousDocument.OnPrintPage(PrintPageEventArgs e) in C:\Users\v-mandiman\Desktop\SampleApp\SampleApp\Form1.cs:line 73
   at System.Drawing.Printing.PrintController.PrintLoop(PrintDocument document)
   at System.Drawing.Printing.PrintController.Print(PrintDocument document)
   at System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.ComputePreview()
   at System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.CalculatePageInfo()


### Steps to reproduce

- Build and run [SampleApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/12115642/SampleApp.zip)
- Click "Print with error" button and observe it
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "An exception popped up when click "Print with error" button" (#9533)

Issues.Title: Cleanup for utilization of target new
Issues.Body:
Tweaks the editor config settings to encourage behavior that matches our coding style:

- We prefer `Foo foo = new()` over `var foo =`.
- `var` for built in types is an error
- Expression bodied members are always ok

A number of the rules got added by just using the editor. I'll continue to iterate.

Changed a big chunk of the code to use target typed new using fixers and regex's for the majority of the changes.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9527)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Cleanup for utilization of target new" (#9527)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in TypeCodeDomSerializer
Issues.Body:
Another follow-up to #9099

## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in `TypeCodeDomSerializer`
- Enable nullability in `CodeDomSerializationProvider`
- Enable nullability in `ComponentTypeCodeDomSerializer`

Issues.Title: Request to backport fix to NET framework
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

NET 4.8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

Hi,

I'm aware I'm wrong here for NET framework issues (as noted in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms#please-note).

However: Both  of these links do not work.

- The "developers community" link fails immediatly with a 403. And if I try to submit I get a "Unexpected error. Sorry, we couldn't send your report, because the server connection timed out.". If I try to submit it from with Visual Studio it also just hangs with "Trying to log in". Frustrating.
- The link to "Product support" website works, but it asks me for a "eligible support plan". Do I need to purchase support for this?

Background: We're running into #2979 and have no easy way to fix it (third party library: DevExpress) and would like to see it fixed.

Again, sorry for the ticket but I have no clue what else to do.

I'd appreciate any help.

Cheers from Germany


### Steps to reproduce

Try to report the issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Request to backport fix to NET framework" (#9515)

Issues.Title: `PropertyStore` refactor for generic wrappers
Issues.Body:
This PR refactors the `PropertyStore` wrappers to generics so they can be used on other struct types. It also adds separate functions for structs with `SetValue<T>`, `GetValue<T>`, and `TryGetValue<T>`.



Fixes #8990
